statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -3 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 6 \\ 10 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^3

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -3 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 6 \\ 10 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^3.
